tizo_trico wrote:
> St.Ack,
>
> I have been testing jmxclient a little more, and I could unregister
> Heritrix instances with destroy, as follow:
>
> java -jar bin/cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar controlRole:letmein
> localhost:8849
> org.archive.crawler:guiport=8080,host=royal-hunt,jmxport=8849,name=Heritrix,type=CrawlService
> destroy
>
> The instances are only unregistered, as they can be accesed by a browser.
>
Hmm.  For me, destroy removes the instance.  Are you using latest or 
last release?  Looks like the destroy was added after 1.6.0 release: 
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1358617&group_id=73833&atid=539102.

Go here for latest: 
http://crawltools.archive.org:8080/cruisecontrol/artifacts/HEAD-heritrix/20060321164451

> What I could not do, is create new instances; if you want, I could
> write here the differents tests, but they are a lot. I have try with
> create and only the class name, create and the class name and the
> instance name, create with all the string, etc. How is the syntax to
> create one?

Sorry for your trouble.

Here is a session I had with a Heritrix creating and destroying 
instances (Commentary begins with '#'):

% # Set 1.5 jdk.
%  export JAVA_HOME=/usr/local/jdk1.5.0_05/
% # Start heritrix
%  ./bin/heritrix
% # List all MBeans.
%  /usr/local/jdk1.5.0_05/bin/java -jar bin/cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar 
controlRole:letmein localhost:8849
% # Add a bean named 'Heritrix2'.  Do it by naming bean same as the 
Heritrix instance created on heritrix start only give it a different 
name (First instance is named 'Heritrix') and by passing the command 
'create' with an argument of the type of bean to create; in this case 
org.archive.crawler.Heritrix
% /usr/local/jdk1.5.0_05/bin/java -jar bin/cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar 
controlRole:letmein localhost:8849 
org.archive.crawler:guiport=8080,host=lautreamont,jmxport=8849,name=Heritrix2,type=CrawlService 
create=org.archive.crawler.Heritrix
% # List all beans.  Notice addition of new bean (Can also check in 
local-instances.jsp in UI).
% /usr/local/jdk1.5.0_05/bin/java -jar bin/cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar 
controlRole:letmein localhost:8849
% # Destroy 'Heritrix2' instance.
 org.archive.crawler:guiport=8080,host=lautreamont,jmxport=8849,name=Heritrix2,type=CrawlService 
destroy
% # List all MBeans. Notice how 'Heritrix2' has been removed.
% /usr/local/jdk1.5.0_05/bin/java -jar bin/cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar 
controlRole:letmein localhost:8849

>
> Talking about HCC, I think that I have not been clear in my last
> question (I read it again, and it gave rise to a misunderstanding).
> What I want to know is, if that HCC could be used to control, create
> and destroy instances of Heritrix that resides in the same JVM, but
> not in the same JVM as HCC. As an example, if I have HCC installed on
> host A, controlling a default Heritrix instance in host B, can HCC be
> used to create another Heritrix instance in the host B, but in the
> same JVM as the default instance?
Yes.  Thats what its all about.

What hcc cannot do is startup Heritrix.  Heritrix must be up and running 
for the hcc to find it.
>
> If that is true, I will give HCC a try, as it could be very useful to
> us, and highly scalable.
Yes.

Be aware that only clients of hcc that I know of are ourselves (in 
archive-it.org service).  It works but its pretty raw.  We should be 
spending a bunch more time on it in near future because we'll be using 
it to coordinate a cluster of crawlers.  Meantime, don't hesitate to 
pass over any improvements you might see fit.

St.Ack
